Python Client for SQLFlow Server¶

class sqlflow.client.Client(server_url=None)¶

Bases: object

A minimum client that issues queries to and fetch results/logs from sqlflowserver.

Parameters

server_url (str.) – sqlflowserver url. If None, read value from environment variable SQLFLOW_SERVER.

Raises

ValueError

Example:

>>> client = sqlflow.Client(server_url="localhost:50051")
classmethod display(stream_response)¶

Display stream response like log or table.row

execute(operation)¶

Run a SQL statement

Parameters

operation (str.) – SQL statement to be executed.

Returns

sqlflow.client.Rows

Example:

>>> client.execute("select * from iris limit 1")
class sqlflow.client.Rows(column_names, rows_gen)¶

Bases: object

Query result of sqlflow.client.Client.execute

Parameters

  • column_names (list[str]) – column names

  • rows_gen (generator) – rows generator

column_names()¶

Column names

Returns

list[str]

rows()¶

Rows

Example:

>>> [r for r in rows.rows()]
Returns

list generator

to_dataframe()¶

Convert Rows to pandas.Dataframe

Returns

pandas.Dataframe

class sqlflow.magic.SqlFlowMagic(shell)¶

Bases: IPython.core.magic.Magics

Provides the %%sqlflow magic

execute(line, cell)¶

Runs SQL statement

Parameters

  • line (str.) – The line magic

  • cell (str.) – The cell magic

Example:

>>> %%sqlflow SELECT *
... FROM mytable

>>> %%sqlflow SELECT *
... FROM iris.iris limit 1
... TRAIN DNNClassifier
... WITH
...   n_classes = 3,
...   hidden_units = [10, 10]
... COLUMN sepal_length, sepal_width, petal_length, petal_width
... LABEL class
... INTO my_dnn_model;
magics = {'cell': {'sqlflow': 'execute'}, 'line': {}}¶
registered = True¶
sqlflow.magic.load_ipython_extension(ipython)¶

pysqlflow
